Female/immature.description: Female Spotted Towhees have white spots on the wings, unlike the solid brown of female Eastern. The two species have almost no range overlap.

Adult male.description: Male Spotted Towhees have white spots on the wings, unlike the solid black of male Eastern. The two species have almost no range overlap.
American Robins are larger than Eastern Towhees, with straighter, thinner bills. Robins have white around the eyes and show white only on the lower belly.
